articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Refugees from Syria's long civil war were making their way home on Wednesday, as a new interim prime minister said he had been appointed with the backing of the rebels who toppled President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Refugees return to Syria as caretaker prime minister appointed

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: South Korea's police chief became the latest top official to be arrested, Yonhap news agency said on Wednesday, in a widening investigation into President Yoon Suk Yeol's failed martial law that has plunged the country into a constitutional crisis.
articles.title: South Korea police chief arrested as Yoon impeachment looms over failed martial law

articles.author: Jonathan Saul
articles.description: Israel's arrest of almost 30 mostly Jewish citizens who allegedly spied for Iran in nine covert cells has caused alarm in the country and points to Tehran's biggest effort in decades to infiltrate its arch foe, four Israeli security sources said.
articles.title: The Israeli Jews who spied for Iran in biggest infiltration in decades

articles.author: Ryan Woo, Ben Blanchard, Yimou Lee
articles.description: China's government said on Wednesday that it takes "necessary measures" to defend the country's sovereignty and will not tolerate "separatist" activities, as Taiwan reported another rise in Chinese warplanes near the island.
articles.title: China says it takes 'necessary measures' to defend sovereignty over Taiwan

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: Seventy-five-year-old Marina Terishvili's teenage son Mamuka was shot dead at a nationalist rally in Georgia in 1992. Now her other son, Giorgi, has been arrested for his role in protests against perceived Russian influence in their homeland.
articles.title: Hundreds of arrests and mysterious beatings as Georgia cracks down on pro-EU protests

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Romania's pro-European parties reached a firm commitment late on Monday to form a governing majority that cordons off the hard right and potentially endorses a single candidate for a re-run of the country's annulled presidential election.
articles.title: Romanian pro-European parties agree to quickly form broad coalition government

articles.author: John Irish, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy used his first meeting with Donald Trump since the U.S. election to explain Ukraine's need for security guarantees in any negotiated end to the war with Russia, two sources familiar with the Dec. 7 discussions said.
articles.title: Zelenskiy made case for security guarantees at meeting with Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: There is more than a 50% chance of La Niña developing in the next three months, the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) said on Wednesday, but if it does it will be relatively weak and short-lived.
articles.title: More than 50% chance of La Nina in coming months, WMO says

articles.author: Julio-Cesar Chavez, Rich McKay
articles.description: Luigi Mangione, the suspect charged with murder in the shooting of a top UnitedHealth executive, briefly struggled with officers and angrily shouted while being escorted into a Pennsylvania courthouse on Tuesday, as a clearer picture of his motives began to emerge a day after his arrest ended a massive manhunt.
articles.title: UnitedHealth murder suspect has angry outburst as details of his life emerge

articles.author: Vijdan Mohammad Kawoosa
articles.description: An interceptor test marked a milestone in the $10 billion American plan to turn the Pacific territory into one of the most heavily defended places on earth.
articles.title: Can a U.S. missile defense system shield Guam from Chinese threat?
